statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Marcus Evans scored 19 points with three 3-pointers and six rebounds and VCU scored 27 points off of 23 forced turnovers in beating Iona 88-59 on Saturday night.
article.headline: Evans scores 19, VCU beats Iona 88-59
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- Marcus Evans scored 19 points with three 3-pointers and six rebounds and VCU scored 27 points off of 23 forced turnovers in beating Iona 88-59 on Saturday night. Marcus Santos-Silva scored 12 points with nine boards for the Rams (6-2), who hit 11 of 30 from distance (37 percent) and held the Gaels to 37 percent shooting. Mike'L Simms and Corey Douglas added 11 points apiece, with Simms hitting three 3s. Issac Vann's dunk off a turnover put VCU up by 26 points, and the Rams twice led by 34, the last on Douglas' one-handed slam with 2:49 left. Douglas' opening 3 sparked a 12-0 run and VCU led 18-8 on Simms' 3 after the Rams forced eight Iona turnovers. Malik Crowfield's 3 capped another 12-0 run for a 30-11 lead and the Rams led 46-27 at halftime. E.J. Crawford and Rickey McGill scored 16 points apiece for Iona (2-5).
